block.p: Kathleen Kermian, an executive at Christie's, and Eric Frederick Leicht, a lawyer, were married yesterday at St. Vartan's Cathedral in New York. Archbishop Khajag Barsamian, the primate of the Eastern Diocese of the Armenian Church in North America, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior vice president and the assistant managing director at Christie's in New York, where she oversees 20th-century decorative arts, wine, books, photography and other departments. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in urban planning from Hunter College.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior vice president and the assistant managing director at Christie's in New York, where she oversees 20th-century decorative arts, wine, books, photography and other departments. She graduated from the University of Michigan and received a master's degree in urban planning from Hunter College.

She is the daughter of Ginger and Michael Kermian of Greenwich, Conn. Her father retired as the president of the international division of the Macmillan Publishing Company in New York. Her mother is a sales associate at Richard's, a boutique in Greenwich.
The bridegroom, 34, is a senior associate at White & Case, a New York law firm. He graduated magna cum laude from Williams College and received a law degree from the University of Virginia.
He is the son of Noel K. Leicht and Fred Leicht Jr., both of St. Louis. His mother designs and makes jewelry in St. Louis. His father is a senior partner in Armstrong, Teasdale, a St. Louis law firm.
